Ping

Status: Demo
Software Used: CLion, GitKraken, GitHub
Languages Used: C++
Textures: Kenney Puzzle 2 Game Assets
Itch.io Page: Zoe Rowbotham - Ping

Ping was the first piece of coursework for my first year of university. The specification was to make a simple Pong clone where a ball can be bounced off paddles and points could be one by the ball travelling off the side.

I went beyond the spec by including a one-player mode in which an AI is used to control the second paddle. The AI is not perfect however, sometimes the ball will move too fast for the paddle and the AI will miss.

I improved my knowledge of collisions for this game and used axis aligned bounding boxes for the paddles and a circle shape for the ball, in order to achieve more accurate collisions.

Below is a video of the AI (the right paddle) at work. This is done by an invisible second ball travelling at a faster speed so the AI can try and position itself correctly. In the video the game is in hard mode, the blue obstacles randomly move up and down. The ball will bounce off these obstacles, sometimes back to the player making it harder to predict gameplay.
